author: mini_mads1980
title: Brings Back Fond Memories
review:
Overview

Another Policeman is the gift with the 17th Issue of the Lego City Comic, available between 31st July and 27th August 2019.  This time we are introduced to the action hero and film buff, Jack McLane.  In addition to Mr McLane we also get a nice little police car and the standard handcuffs, although no-one for them to be used on.

Packet

The foil pack is the perfect size for this set and holds the parts well.

Minifigure

Jack appears in three sets, but only one standard City set (60143).  He has a rather serious expression on his face so I can only assume that he is hot on the trail of a Lego City criminal.  I hope for the crook attached to Issue 1's sake it's not him, as there have been five police Minifigures attached to comics against only one criminal.  Although we all know that crime is a major problem in Lego City based on the size of the Police Force, so it could be anyone.

His torso appears in 15 sets, so it is quite common and would be easy to get should you want to.  I alway think it would be nice to include the hair for a Minifigure as well as a hat, but the set loses nothing with it's omission.

Main Build/Parts

This build took me back to one of my favourite sets from years ago, Victory Cup Racers, which I still have the box for and spent many hours driving around my Lego city when I was younger loading them into my brothers Cargo Ship, as they headed to the Train the other side of the river.  It is based on the Chassis 4x7 and makes a great small car.  It might be a bit small for recent sets, but does the job well.  You also get a printed 2x2 sloped element which adds good detail as without it the set would be too plain.

Verdict

Certainly one of the better Police sets from the comics, only narrowly beaten by Issue 1's offering as it comes with a Policeman and a Crook.  I would rather get two Minifigures for the play value than have a mini-build that is limited by itself, despite how much I like the car.  At £4.25 it's good value for a comic and 31 pieces.

Next month we head to the stars as we get an astronaut and robot, on sale 28th August 2019.
